conbody.p: file name expressionwriting whole filesWhen writing whole files, you configure a File Name Expression property in the destination. The expression defines the name for the target file.
You can use record:value and string functions in the expression. By default, destinations use the following file name expression, which uses the original source file name as the target file name:

section.title: Example
section.p: You want a pipeline to pass whole files from a local directory to Amazon S3. For the target file name, you want to append the .json file extension to the original file name. To do this, you can configure the File Name Expression as follows: ${str:concat(record:value('/fileInfo/filename'), ".json")}
